resource.chars:
Fig.
8. Portion of Fig.1 enlarged, to show the ordinary mode
in which the segments of each zone are connected by
peduncles with the <u>annular band</u> of the preceding zone,
so as to alternate with its segments; with the occasion-
al interpolation of additional segments, <u>a,a</u>, whose
peduncles come-off from the <u>segments</u> of the preceding 
zone:- 90 diam.
9. Portion of Plate II, Fig 2, enlarged, to show <s>a parallel</s>
the corresponding appearances presented by the shell;
each cell being ordinarily connected by radial a passage with the <u>annu-
lar canal</u> of the preceding zone, and thus with the two
cells alternating with itself; but cells <u>a,a</u>, being some
times interpolated, which open directly into the <u>cells/u>
of the preceding zone:- 90 diam.
10. <s>Nucleus</s> Central and circumambient segments (<u>a</u> and <u>bb</u>) of a large disk, showing the origin of the <s>first</s>
segments of the first annular zone, <u>c,c</u>, from <s>only a</s> less than
<s>portion of</s> half the circumference of the <s>circum</s> nucleus:- 84 diam.
11. Peculiar bodies (ova?), found in the substance of the
sarcode in different parts, showing successive stages, <u>a,b,cc,d,e,f</u>
